entry.title: How to order in a SAC chart without displaying the ordering dimension itself?
entry.content:
hi,

we use a SAC datashere model. for aa story in SAC cloud.

I have to order the chart from the current posting period descending.

for this we create a extra dimension (PP_Sorted) in DSP for teh correct order:

The dimension "PP_Sorted"  (1) i use to order the chart, but i want to display only the "Posting period" (2)  in the chart. (see screenshot below)

is it possible or other ideas?

e.g. August - February

posting period     PP_Sorted 

  •  005     1
  • 004       2
  • 003       3
  • 002       4
  • 001       5
  • 012       6
  • 011       7

     

    

 best regards

Oliver

entry.title: Cost Center Activity Cost Rate Planning Cost Calculation OPEX IFP
entry.content:
Dear All,

Could anyone assist me in understanding the code used to calculate cost center costs? While I understand the calculation logic for Amount and Quantity—since activity quantities are credited from the sender side—I’m not sure about the purpose of a specific part of the code. Could you please explain what that section is doing, and how we can verify it in SAC using dimensions and measures?

What is the purpose of running the Cost Rates data action in OPEX for cost rates? It seems that nothing new is being calculated—the same price appears as hard-coded in the actuals. Wouldn’t it be simpler to just copy those rates instead of performing the calculation?

entry.title: SAC - Import Business Content Error - Dimension Already Exists
entry.content:
Hi Folks, 

I was wondering if someone can help. I am trying to import business content into SAC. I deleted some models and want to recreate them. But two dimensions are giving issues. 

 

I am not able to import those dimensions as it says they already exist. I have tried every option. Even when trying to overwrite them. 

 

I get the error: 

Couldn't import object 'Country_G282m4e01m4z400 [Country_G282m4e01m4z400]' : Dimension t.S.SAP__HR_GEN_IM_EC_HEADCOUNT:Country_G282m4e01m4z400 already exists

 

And then when I try to import the related model, I get an error saying that they do not exist. 

Couldn't import object 'SAP__HR_GEN_IM_EC_HEADCOUNT [t.S.SAP__HR_GEN_IM_EC_HEADCOUNT%3ASAP__HR_GEN_IM_EC_HEADCOUNT]' : Objects DIMENSION:t.S.SAP__HR_GEN_IM_EC_HEADCOUNT:GeoLocation_G3vi6w0v4c6r0,DIMENSION:t.S.SAP__HR_GEN_IM_EC_HEADCOUNT:Country_G282m4e01m4z400 might already be deleted or did not exist in the system

 

So I am really stuck. Any help would be really appreciated. 

 

Best regards, 

    Seamus

entry.title: SAC Story - use dropdown for Dimension Property
entry.content:
I am using an SAC Story on top of a planning model.

I am wanting to add a dropdown widget for “Country” – which is the property of dimension “Plant”.

The below code, which was added to onInititalization of a page, successfully adds “Plant” members to a dropdown list and defaults to “A001”.

I am now wanting to change the below code to now instead add members of the property “Country”.

But I am not finding the correct API/functions/code to use.

I have found some blogs online but they all relate to using an Analytic Application and not a Story.

Can someone please help with the script?

Thanks

Anton

var dimPlant = Table_1.getDataSource().getMembers("Plant");
for( var i = 0; i< dimPlant.length; i++ )
	{
		Dropdown_Plant.addItem(dimPlant [i].id, dimPlant [i].description);
	}

Dropdown_Plant.setSelectedKey("A001");

entry.title: Data Action and null
entry.content:
Hi
i give here a short example but this thing is complicate me everytime i need to to calculation that in the measure there is null and not 0
i need a way (script or data action to replace null with 0)

I have dimension cost center

Measure 1 - is valid (can be 1 or null -)

Measure 2 - Act 2025

Measure 3 - Bud 2026

The data action need to calculate Bud 2026 as 
Act 2025 * Measure 1

This way only cost center with 1 will appear 

but when i do if in the data action its not taking the null as 0
its oblivious the null

could anyone of you assist am I doing wrong or am I misinterpretating ?

reusult

entry.title: Unit/Currency Display in Table after Data Entry
entry.content: When entering values in a planning-enabled table with Units/Currency displayed in the row axis, the unit/currency not appearing immediately until the table is refreshed. Is this the limitation of SAP Analytics cloud ?

entry.title: SAC Story - Dropdown for property of Date dimension.
entry.content:
While using an SAC Story on top of a Planning Model, and with the help of @nikhil (link below), I am able to successfully add properties of a generic dimension to a Dropdown widget. I am now wanting to do the same for the Date dimension property "CALMONTH".

However, after copying the working code, and where applicable changing it to use the dimension "Date" and the property "CALMONTH", the dropdown remains unpopulated on initialization.  I have tried using a different Date property and also recreated a new model, but I get the same blank Dropdown result each time.

Can anyone please advise where things are going wrong?  Or can anyone please confirm that the below code is working in their environment?

Otherwise failing that, does anyone have another method of populating a Date dimension's property in a Dropdown?

Thanks

Anton

var dimDate = PlanningModel_1.getMembers("Date");
var CALMONTHmemberId = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string);

for( var i = 0; i< dimDate.length; i++ )
	{		
		var currentCALMONTH = dimDate[i].properties.CALMONTH;
		if(CALMONTHmemberId.indexOf(currentCALMONTH) === -1 && currentCALMONTH)
			{
			   CALMONTHmemberId.push(currentCALMONTH);
			   Dropdown_CALMONTH.addItem(currentCALMONTH);
			}
	}

 

(Working solution - https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/sac-story-use-dropdown-for-dimension-property/qaa-p/14177305/emcs_t/S2h8ZW1haWx8dG9waWNfc3Vic2NyaXB0aW9ufE1FNldFWDlSNjVLNjF8MTQxNzczMDV8U1VCU0NSSVBUSU9OU3xoSw#M4922567)

entry.title: SAC Story - Date Dimension properties not available in scripting
entry.content:
In an SAC Story, which is using a Planning Model as the source, I am wanting to use the "setDimensionFilter" function on a property of the Date dimension.  However, the selected value is not being passed to the filter.  I have noticed that when I type "Table_1.getDataSource().setDimensionFilter(" and then do a Ctrl + spacebar, only "Date" is listed in the available options - ie. the list does not include the likes of "Date.CALMONTH", etc.

This behaviour is only happeing at a particular client.

To replicate the issue I did the follwoing at 2 separate clients:

  • Created a new model - "Start with an empty model"
  • Added a measure "Value"
  • On the Date dimension, I changed the granularity to "Day"
  • Saved the model
  • From "Actions", created new story - Canvas
  • Added Table_1
  • For the page, added onInitialization script: Table_1.getDataSource().setDimensionFilter(
  • Then Ctrl + spacebar

In the one client, the displayed list includes all the system generated properties of the Date dimension.  Eg "Date.CALMONTH", "Date.CALWEEK", etc. (1st screenshot below)

But in the other client system, I just see "Date".  Ie. no additional fields for the properties. (2nd screenshot below).

Both SAC environments are in the same data center - eu10.  And user auths are the same - both Admin rights.

Is there any reason why the Date properties wouldn't be available at the one client?

Rgds

Anton

 

Client #1 - Date properties listed and available for use

 

Client #2 - Date properties not listed and not available for use.

entry.title: How to Transport SAC Models and Import Jobs between Tenants without including the Source Connection
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are performing a migration between SAC tenants.
One tenant is QAS, where the data models are connected to an S4 QAS system, and the other tenant is PRD, where the migrated data models should connect to the S4 PRD system.

The client’s requirement is that in SAC QAS there should only be the S4 QAS connection, and in SAC PRD there should only be the S4 PRD connection.

At the moment, the only working method we found to migrate the models, while keeping their Import Jobs and transformations, is:

  1. Export the model with the source connection from QAS.

  2. Import it into PRD.

  3. Replace the data source in the Import Job with the PRD connection.

  4. Delete the QAS connection imported into PRD.

We are looking for a more efficient approach.

Is there a way to:

  • Redirect the connection during export/import, or

  • Transport Import Jobs (including transformations) without having to export the QAS connection?

Regarding this second point, we found old notes mentioning an object called “Wrangler” that would migrate transformations, but we cannot find this object anymore.
Reference: SAP Community discussion on "Wrangler" object. 

Any guidance or updated best practice would be appreciated.

Thanks

entry.title: How to build single SAC analytic report where each column can have its own version?
entry.content:
Hello, 
I know that my question is a bit tricky SAC because by default, version and date filters are story-level or widget-level, not column-specific.

However, I have a SAC for planning model. the model has several version used during several years I need to create an analytic report with different column where I can filter for each column a different combination.

as my client adds versions from time to time, and I don't know how many years the model can be used, I'd like to avoid endless combination of restricted measures. I'm seeking for something else

for example: budget 2026 vs forecast 2024 then Actual 2024 vs budget 2023.

How can I build such a report (including the java script code)?

Thank you!

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud - Change System Date of a Model
entry.content:

I’m trying to find a way to change the current date in a model so that when I use the Today() function in a Data Action, it returns a newly defined month based on my settings.

Is there a way to achieve this?

Kind regards,
Ismail
